chinese: using computers 使用计算机的
examples: e.g. Students may pursue research in any aspect of [[computational]] linguistics based on their own interest.

chinese: [U] when sth. begins to be known or noticed 出现；显现
examples: e.g. Future research should look at the behavior and ecology of these worms to understand what caused the [[emergence]] of new species.

chinese: 1) [C, U] mind and thoughts 思想；意识
examples: e.g. The flow of everyday life provides a context in which individual human [[consciousness]] operates.；e.g. When the man finally regains [[consciousness]] and walks to a mirror, he is unsure of who he is.

chinese: 2) [U] the condition of being awake and able to understand what is happening around you 神志清醒
examples: e.g. The flow of everyday life provides a context in which individual human [[consciousness]] operates.；e.g. When the man finally regains [[consciousness]] and walks to a mirror, he is unsure of who he is.

chinese: based on or influenced by personal feelings, tastes or opinions rather than facts 主观的
examples: e.g. We know that taste in art is a [[subjective]] matter and differs from person to person.

chinese: 1) a strange habit or feature of sb.'s character, or a strange feature of sth. 怪癖；古怪
examples: e.g. She took pride in her children's [[quirks]] and individuality, and made no effort to try to change them.；e.g. Years later, by a strange [[quirk]] of fate, she found herself sitting next to him on a plane.

chinese: 2) sth. strange that happens by chance （偶然发生的）奇事，巧合
examples: e.g. She took pride in her children's [[quirks]] and individuality, and made no effort to try to change them.；e.g. Years later, by a strange [[quirk]] of fate, she found herself sitting next to him on a plane.

chinese: [C] (esp. BrE) the period of time it takes for sth. to happen or be completed （做某事所需要的）时间，时段
examples: e.g. The [[time-scale]] for completing the work would be fairly tight and we have to work hard.

chinese: (AmE empathize) be able to understand sb. else's feelings, problems, etc., esp. because you have had similar experiences 同情；有同感；产生共鸣
examples: e.g. My mother died last year so I can really [[empathise]] with what he's going through.

chinese: think of a new idea, plan, etc. and develop it in your mind 构思，设想，想出（新的主意、计划等）
examples: e.g. Scientists first [[conceived]] the idea of the atomic bomb in the 1930s.；e.g. Language may be [[conceived]] of as a process which arises from social interaction.

chinese: v.(fml.) imagine a particular situation or think about sth. in a particular way 想象；构想；设想
examples: e.g. Scientists first [[conceived]] the idea of the atomic bomb in the 1930s.；e.g. Language may be [[conceived]] of as a process which arises from social interaction.

chinese: [C] (esp. BrE) (also artifact esp. AmE) an object such as a tool or weapon that was made in the past and is historically important 人工制品，手工艺品（有史学价值的工具、武器等）
examples: e.g. The museum is well-known for having many [[artefacts]] dating back to prehistoric times.

chinese: if a piece of writing, set of ideas, etc. is coherent, it is easy to understand because it is clear and reasonable （文章、观点等）连贯的，有条理的，一致的
examples: e.g. It makes me crazy that the board seems to have no [[coherent]] plan for saving the company.

chinese: in a way that is difficult to believe and therefore unlikely to be true 难以置信地；不可能真实地
examples: e.g. He argued, somewhat [[implausibly]], that the accident could not have been prevented.

chinese: [C, U] the act of forming a wrong understanding of sth. that is said or done, or an example of a wrong understanding 误解
examples: e.g. It appears that this universally promoted idea was based on a [[misinterpretation]] of the test results.

chinese: in the traditional or original way 正宗地；原汁原味地
examples: e.g. Consumers are increasingly interested in the [[authentically]] prepared food.

chinese: [C] （大型的）管弦乐队
[C] 交响乐；交响曲
much; a lot 很；非常；相当大（多）地
examples: e.g. Housing conditions in this area have improved [[considerably]] over the past few years.

chinese: 1) [pl.] the shape and size of a room, which affect the way sound is heard in it （房间的）传声效果，音响效果
examples: e.g. The auditorium has comfortable seating and modern [[acoustics]].

chinese: 2) [U] the scientific study of sound 声学
examples: e.g. The auditorium has comfortable seating and modern [[acoustics]].

chinese: (esp. BrE) (AmE formalize) make a plan, decision, or idea official, esp. by deciding and clearly describing all the details 使（计划、决定或想法）正式化；使定形；使具体化
examples: e.g. Final arrangements for the takeover of the company have yet to be [[formalised]].

chinese: (usu. before noun) relating to a particular context 与上下文有关的
examples: e.g. Now We need to examine the role of [[contextual]] factors directly and in more detail.

chinese: 1) do sth. that has been carefully planned 实行；执行
examples: e.g. The job involves drawing up and [[executing]] a plan of nursing care.；e.g. Anyone caught trying to escape from that prison would be [[executed]].

chinese: 2) kill sb., esp. legally as a punishment （尤指依法）将···处死
examples: e.g. The job involves drawing up and [[executing]] a plan of nursing care.；e.g. Anyone caught trying to escape from that prison would be [[executed]].

chinese: 1) a list of the exact amounts of the ingredients that are used for making sth. 配方
examples: e.g. The [[formulas]] for these drinks are closely guarded secrets of the company.；e.g. He developed a mathematical [[formula]] describing the distances of the planets from the Sun.

chinese: 2) a series of numbers or letters that represent a mathematical or scientific rule 公式；方程式；分子式
examples: e.g. The [[formulas]] for these drinks are closely guarded secrets of the company.；e.g. He developed a mathematical [[formula]] describing the distances of the planets from the Sun.

chinese: 1) relating to art or culture 美术的；艺术的
examples: e.g. According to a famous art critic, opinion about the [[artistic]] merit of his paintings has been mixed.；e.g. His friends are all [[artistic]] — they're painters, musicians, dancers, and writers.

chinese: 2) good at painting, drawing, or producing beautiful things 艺术精湛的；有艺术才华的
examples: e.g. According to a famous art critic, opinion about the [[artistic]] merit of his paintings has been mixed.；e.g. His friends are all [[artistic]] — they're painters, musicians, dancers, and writers.

chinese: [U] (of one's own ~) (fml.) if you do sth. of your own volition, you do it because you want to, not because you are forced to 出于自愿
examples: e.g. To everyone's astonishment, Helena left the company of her own [[volition]].

chinese: (only before noun) (fml.) connected with a procedure 程序性的；手续上的
examples: e.g. The business of the committee was delayed by [[procedural]] difficulties.

chinese: 1) (fml.) having the ability to work and make decisions by yourself without any help from anyone else 有自主能力的；自主的
examples: e.g. It is teachers' responsibility to help children become [[autonomous]] learners.；e.g. Five provinces are to become [[autonomous]] regions in the new federal system of government.

chinese: 2) an autonomous place or organization is free to govern or control itself （地方或机构）自治的
examples: e.g. It is teachers' responsibility to help children become [[autonomous]] learners.；e.g. Five provinces are to become [[autonomous]] regions in the new federal system of government.

chinese: if people interact with each other, they talk to each other, work together, etc. 交流；交往；互相来往
examples: e.g. The little girl's teacher told her mom that she [[interacted]] well with the other children.

chinese: 1) an interactive computer program, television system, etc. allows you to communicate directly with it, and does things in reaction to your actions （计算机程序、电视系统等）交互的，互动的
examples: e.g. This is an [[interactive]] museum where children can actively manipulate the exhibits.；e.g. Our school encourages [[interactive]] teaching methods, such as role playing.

chinese: 2) involving talking and working together 合作的； 相互交流的
examples: e.g. This is an [[interactive]] museum where children can actively manipulate the exhibits.；e.g. Our school encourages [[interactive]] teaching methods, such as role playing.

chinese: [U] the state of wanting to do or have sth. very much, esp. sth. interesting or enjoyable 渴望
examples: e.g. People were pushing each other out of the way in their [[eagerness]] to get to the front.

chinese: [U] the ability to understand sth. 理解（力）
examples: e.g. It's annoying that they don't have the least [[comprehension]] of what I'm trying to do.

chinese: in the true or exact meaning of the word or phrase 从字面意义来看；严格地说
examples: e.g. There wasn't much vegetarian food as such, although there were several types of salads.
